decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to establish control through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. Using cards like Force of Will, Brainstorm, and Swords to Plowshares, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition. The inclusion of versatile cards like Prismatic Ending and Dress Down allows for flexibility in dealing with a variety of threats, while Snapcaster Mage provides additional value by recasting important spells from the graveyard.

The deck focuses on quickly applying pressure to the opponent with cheap and efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, supported by disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze. It also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to deal with threats, as well as card draw and filtering with Ponder, Brainstorm, and Mishra's Bauble. The deck further disrupts the opponent's game plan with cards like Stifle and Wasteland, while also providing versatility with cards like Brazen Borrower and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student.

This deck focuses on utilizing mana acceleration and disruptive elements to quickly deploy powerful threats, primarily Dragons, and disrupt opponents' game plans. It capitalizes on the synergy between cards like City of Traitors, Chrome Mox, Simian Spirit Guide, and Ancient Tomb to power out threats ahead of schedule. Magus of the Moon and Blood Moon shut down opponents' nonbasic lands, while Chalice of the Void disrupts low-cost spells. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays and lock down the board with disruptive effects.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures with the help of Eldrazi Temple and Ancient Tomb, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also utilizes lands like Cavern of Souls and Wasteland to ensure its spells and creatures resolve smoothly. With a mix of aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and Devourer of Destiny, as well as disruptive spells like Kozilek's Command, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its Eldrazi threats and close out games quickly.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought-Knot Seer, Chalice of the Void, and Reality Smasher. Using mana acceleration from Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal, along with color fixing from Cavern of Souls, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with large threats like It That Heralds the End and Sire of Seven Deaths. Additionally, cards like Wasteland and Wastescape+Battlemage','','');">Wastescape Battlemage provide disruptive elements to control the opponent's resources.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void to shut down opposing strategies, Eldrazi Temple to accelerate mana, and cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher to apply pressure, the deck aims to quickly close out games. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Wasteland and Ancient Tomb help to disrupt the opponent's mana base, further increasing the deck's aggressive potential.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, and then bring them back to the battlefield with spells like Reanimate. This allows you to cheat mana costs and overwhelm your opponent with big creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty. Cards like Force of Will and Daze help protect your strategy while Brazen Borrower provides additional utility. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Wasteland to disrupt your opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on assembling powerful creatures from the graveyard using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, while controlling the game with counterspells like Force of Will and disruptive spells like Thoughtseize. It also utilizes card draw and selection with Brainstorm and Ponder to find the combo pieces needed to win the game quickly. The deck aims to quickly reanimate high-impact creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The key premise of this deck is to utilize the interactions between Nomads en-Kor and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to create a powerful combo that can generate a competitive advantage. The deck is also focused on utilizing cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Brainstorm to search for key pieces of the combo and manipulate the top of the library. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the opponent's plays and protect its own game plan. Ultimately, the goal is to outmaneuver the opponent and secure a win through strategic play.

The deck revolves around putting powerful creatures into play quickly and efficiently using Show and Tell while also utilizing cards like Omniscience and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn to overwhelm the opponent. It includes counter spells like Force of Will and Daze for protection, as well as ramping cards like Lotus Petal and Chalice of the Void. The goal is to establish a dominant board presence early in the game and potentially win in just a few turns with the combo pieces.

The main objective of this deck is to assemble the Cephalid Breakfast combo, utilizing cards like Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill cards and put Narcomoeba into play. By combining these cards with Dread Return and Thassa's Oracle, the deck aims to win the game through a quick and efficient combo. The inclusion of cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Urza's Saga provide additional support and consistency to help execute the combo effectively. The deck prioritizes fast and powerful plays to overwhelm opponents and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate. It also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. With creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Atraxa, Grand Unifier provide card advantage and utility, while Brazen Borrower and Wasteland offer additional control options. The deck's goal is to efficiently reanimate strong creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

The deck revolves around utilizing Mystic Forge to generate incredible value and combo off by casting artifacts from the top of the library. The deck includes a variety of artifact mana sources, card draw engines like Tezzeret, and powerful payoff cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Planar Nexus. By assembling the right pieces and utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Urza lands, the deck can quickly ramp up to play its powerful threats and overwhelming the opponent with a wide range of threats and combos.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently mill through the entire deck to get to either Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return, in order to win the game with a win condition that focuses on a combo strategy. The deck includes a combination of creatures, spells, and rituals that work together to achieve this goal, while also incorporating cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to disrupt opponent's game plans. The focus is on speed, consistency, and precision in executing the combo strategy to secure victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on comboing off by using Cephalid Illusionist in combination with Nomads en-Kor to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Narcomoeba and Thassa's Oracle. The deck protects its combo pieces with counter magic like Force of Will and uses cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the pieces it needs. Urza's Saga provides additional value by tutoring for key artifacts like Shuko, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps dig for combo pieces. The deck aims to win the game by quickly assembling its combo and utilizing various card synergies to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck revolves around efficiently generating card advantage and creating a powerful board presence using artifacts and synergistic combo pieces. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga enable recursion and tutoring for key cards like Nadu, Winged Wisdom, which can quickly overwhelm the opponent with card draw and powerful abilities. The inclusion of counterspells like Force of Will and disruption like Sink into Stupor helps to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to outpace and outvalue the opponent.
